00057 /**
00058  * Represents a single request/response pair of an application process.
00059  *
00060  * Session is used to forward a single HTTP request to an application
00061  * process, and to read back the HTTP response. A Session object is to
00062  * be used in the following manner:
00063  *
00064  *  -# Serialize the HTTP request headers into a format as expected by
00065  *     sendHeaders(), then send that string by calling sendHeaders().
00066  *  -# In case of a POST of PUT request, send the HTTP request body by
00067  *     calling sendBodyBlock(), possibly multiple times.
00068  *  -# Shutdown the writer end of the session channel (shutdownWriter())
00069  *     since you're now done sending data.
00070  *  -# The HTTP response can now be read through the session channel (getStream()).
00071  *  -# When the HTTP response has been read, the session must be closed.
00072  *     This is done by destroying the Session object.
00073  *
00074  * A usage example is shown in Process::newSession().
00075  *
00076  * Session is an abstract base class. Concrete implementations can be found in
00077  * StandardSession and ApplicationPool::Client::RemoteSession.
00078  *
00079  * Session is not guaranteed to be thread-safe.
00080  */
00081 class Session {
00082 protected:
00083         string detachKey;
00084         string connectPassword;
00085         string gupid;
00086         
00087 public:
00088         /**
00089          * Concrete classes might throw arbitrary exceptions.
00090          */
00091         virtual ~Session() {}
00092         
00093         /**
00094          * Initiate the session by connecting to the associated process.
00095          * A Session is not usable until it's initiated.
00096          *
00097          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong.
00098          * @throws IOException Something went wrong.
00099          * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00100          */
00101         virtual void initiate() = 0;
00102         
00103         /**
00104          * Returns whether this session has been initiated (that is, whether
00105          * initiate() had been called in the past).
00106          */
00107         virtual bool initiated() const = 0;
00108         
00109         /**
00110          * Returns the type of the socket that this session is served from,
00111          * e.g. "unix" indicating a Unix socket.
00112          *
00113          * @post !result.empty()
00114          */
00115         virtual string getSocketType() const = 0;
00116         
00117         /**
00118          * Returns the address of the socket that this session is served
00119          * from. This can be a Unix socket filename or a TCP host:port string
00120          * like "127.0.0.1:1234".
00121          *
00122          * @post !result.empty()
00123          */
00124         virtual string getSocketName() const = 0;
00125         
00126         /**
00127          * Send HTTP request headers to the application. The HTTP headers must be
00128          * converted into CGI headers, and then encoded into a string that matches this grammar:
00129          *
00130            @verbatim
00131            headers ::= header*
00132            header ::= name NUL value NUL
00133            name ::= notnull+
00134            value ::= notnull+
00135            notnull ::= "\x01" | "\x02" | "\x02" | ... | "\xFF"
00136            NUL = "\x00"
00137            @endverbatim
00138          *
00139          * There must be a header with the name "PASSWORD_CONNECT_PASSWORD", and it must
00140          * have the same value as the string returned by getConnectPassword().
00141          *
00142          * This method should be the first one to be called during the lifetime of a Session
00143          * object, otherwise strange things may happen.
00144          *
00145          * @param headers The HTTP request headers, converted into CGI headers and encoded as
00146          *                a string, according to the description.
00147          * @param size The size, in bytes, of <tt>headers</tt>.
00148          * @pre headers != NULL
00149          * @pre initiated()
00150          * @throws IOException The I/O channel has already been closed or discarded.
00151          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong during writing.
00152          * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00153          */
00154         virtual void sendHeaders(const char *headers, unsigned int size) {
00155                 TRACE_POINT();
00156                 int stream = getStream();
00157                 if (stream == -1) {
00158                         throw IOException("Cannot write headers to the request handler "
00159                                 "because the I/O stream has already been closed or discarded.");
00160                 }
00161                 try {
00162                         MessageChannel(stream).writeScalar(headers, size);
00163                 } catch (SystemException &e) {
00164                         e.setBriefMessage("An error occured while writing headers "
00165                                 "to the request handler");
00166                         throw;
00167                 }
00168         }
00169         
00170         /**
00171          * Convenience shortcut for sendHeaders(const char *, unsigned int)
00172          * @param headers The headers
00173          * @pre initiated()
00174          * @throws IOException The I/O channel has already been closed or discarded.
00175          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong during writing.
00176          * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00177          */
00178         virtual void sendHeaders(const StaticString &headers) {
00179                 sendHeaders(headers.c_str(), headers.size());
00180         }
00181         
00182         /**
00183          * Send a chunk of HTTP request body data to the application.
00184          * You can call this method as many times as is required to transfer
00185          * the entire HTTP request body.
00186          *
00187          * This method must only be called after a sendHeaders(), otherwise
00188          * strange things may happen.
00189          *
00190          * @param block A block of HTTP request body data to send.
00191          * @param size The size, in bytes, of <tt>block</tt>.
00192          * @pre initiated()
00193          * @throws IOException The I/O channel has already been closed or discarded.
00194          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong during writing.
00195          * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00196          */
00197         virtual void sendBodyBlock(const char *block, unsigned int size) {
00198                 TRACE_POINT();
00199                 int stream = getStream();
00200                 if (stream == -1) {
00201                         throw IOException("Cannot write request body block to the "
00202                                 "request handler because the I/O channel has "
00203                                 "already been closed or discarded.");
00204                 }
00205                 try {
00206                         writeExact(stream, block, size);
00207                 } catch (SystemException &e) {
00208                         e.setBriefMessage("An error occured while sending the "
00209                                 "request body to the request handler");
00210                         throw;
00211                 }
00212         }
00213         
00214         /**
00215          * Returns this session's channel's file descriptor. This stream is
00216          * full-duplex, and will be automatically closed upon Session's
00217          * destruction, unless discardStream() is called.
00218          *
00219          * @pre initiated()
00220          * @returns The file descriptor, or -1 if the I/O channel has already
00221          *          been closed or discarded.
00222          */
00223         virtual int getStream() const = 0;
00224         
00225         /**
00226          * Set the timeout value for reading data from the I/O channel.
00227          * If no data can be read within the timeout period, then the
00228          * read call will fail with error EAGAIN or EWOULDBLOCK.
00229          *
00230          * @pre The I/O channel hasn't been closed or discarded.
00231          * @pre initiated()
00232          * @param msec The timeout, in milliseconds. If 0 is given,
00233          *             there will be no timeout.
00234          * @throws SystemException Cannot set the timeout.
00235          */
00236         virtual void setReaderTimeout(unsigned int msec) = 0;
00237         
00238         /**
00239          * Set the timeout value for writing data from the I/O channel.
00240          * If no data can be written within the timeout period, then the
00241          * write call will fail with error EAGAIN or EWOULDBLOCK.
00242          *
00243          * @pre The I/O channel hasn't been closed or discarded.
00244          * @pre initiated()
00245          * @param msec The timeout, in milliseconds. If 0 is given,
00246          *             there will be no timeout.
00247          * @throws SystemException Cannot set the timeout.
00248          */
00249         virtual void setWriterTimeout(unsigned int msec) = 0;
00250         
00251         /**
00252          * Indicate that we don't want to read data anymore from the I/O channel.
00253          * Calling this method after closeStream()/discardStream() is called will
00254          * have no effect.
00255          *
00256          * @pre initiated()
00257          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong.
00258          * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00259          */
00260         virtual void shutdownReader() = 0;
00261         
00262         /**
00263          * Indicate that we don't want to write data anymore to the I/O channel.
00264          * Calling this method after closeStream()/discardStream() is called will
00265          * have no effect.
00266          *
00267          * @pre initiated()
00268          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong.
00269          * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00270          */
00271         virtual void shutdownWriter() = 0;
00272         
00273         /**
00274          * Close the I/O stream.
00275          *
00276          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong.
00277          * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00278          * @pre initiated()
00279          * @post getStream() == -1
00280          */
00281         virtual void closeStream() = 0;
00282         
00283         /**
00284          * Discard the I/O channel's file descriptor, so that the destructor
00285          * won't automatically close it.
00286          *
00287          * @pre initiated()
00288          * @post getStream() == -1
00289          */
00290         virtual void discardStream() = 0;
00291         
00292         /**
00293          * Get the process ID of the application process that this session
00294          * belongs to.
00295          */
00296         virtual pid_t getPid() const = 0;

00299                 return detachKey;

00306         const string getConnectPassword() const {

00318 /**
00319  * A "standard" implementation of Session.
00320  */
00321 class StandardSession: public Session {
00322 public:
00323         typedef function<void (const StandardSession *)> CloseCallback;
00324         
00325 protected:
00326         pid_t pid;
00327         CloseCallback closeCallback;
00328         string socketType;
00329         string socketName;
00330         
00331         /** The session connection file descriptor. */
00332         int fd;
00333         bool isInitiated;
00334         
00335 public:
00336         StandardSession(pid_t pid,
00337                         const CloseCallback &closeCallback,
00338                         const string &socketType,
00339                         const string &socketName,
00340                         const string &detachKey,
00341                         const string &connectPassword,
00342                         const string &gupid)
00343         {
00344                 TRACE_POINT();
00345                 if (socketType != "unix" && socketType != "tcp") {
00346                         throw IOException("Unsupported socket type '" + socketType + "'");
00347                 }
00348                 this->pid = pid;
00349                 this->closeCallback = closeCallback;
00350                 this->socketType    = socketType;
00351                 this->socketName    = socketName;
00352                 this->detachKey     = detachKey;
00353                 this->connectPassword = connectPassword;
00354                 this->gupid         = gupid;
00355                 fd = -1;
00356                 isInitiated = false;
00357         }
00358         
00359         virtual ~StandardSession() {
00360                 TRACE_POINT();
00361                 closeStream();
00362                 if (closeCallback != NULL) {
00363                         closeCallback(this);
00364                 }
00365         }
00366         
00367         virtual void initiate() {
00368                 TRACE_POINT();
00369                 if (socketType == "unix") {
00370                         fd = connectToUnixServer(socketName.c_str());
00371                 } else {
00372                         vector<string> args;
00373                         
00374                         split(socketName, ':', args);
00375                         if (args.size() != 2 || atoi(args[1]) == 0) {
00376                                 UPDATE_TRACE_POINT();
00377                                 throw IOException("Invalid TCP/IP address '" + socketName + "'");
00378                         }
00379                         fd = connectToTcpServer(args[0].c_str(), atoi(args[1]));
00380                 }
00381                 isInitiated = true;
00382         }
00383         
00384         virtual bool initiated() const {
00385                 return isInitiated;
00386         }
00387         
00388         virtual string getSocketType() const {
00389                 return socketType;
00390         }
00391         
00392         virtual string getSocketName() const {
00393                 return socketName;
00394         }
00395         
00396         virtual int getStream() const {
00397                 return fd;
00398         }
00399         
00400         virtual void setReaderTimeout(unsigned int msec) {
00401                 MessageChannel(fd).setReadTimeout(msec);
00402         }
00403         
00404         virtual void setWriterTimeout(unsigned int msec) {
00405                 MessageChannel(fd).setWriteTimeout(msec);
00406         }
00407         
00408         virtual void shutdownReader() {
00409                 TRACE_POINT();
00410                 if (fd != -1) {
00411                         int ret = syscalls::shutdown(fd, SHUT_RD);
00412                         if (ret == -1) {
00413                                 int e = errno;
00414                                 // ENOTCONN is harmless here.
00415                                 if (e != ENOTCONN) {
00416                                         throw SystemException("Cannot shutdown the reader stream",
00417                                                 e);
00418                                 }
00419                         }
00420                 }
00421         }
00422         
00423         virtual void shutdownWriter() {
00424                 TRACE_POINT();
00425                 if (fd != -1) {
00426                         int ret = syscalls::shutdown(fd, SHUT_WR);
00427                         if (ret == -1) {
00428                                 int e = errno;
00429                                 // ENOTCONN is harmless here.
00430                                 if (e != ENOTCONN) {
00431                                         throw SystemException("Cannot shutdown the writer stream",
00432                                                 e);
00433                                 }
00434                         }
00435                 }
00436         }
00437         
00438         virtual void closeStream() {
00439                 TRACE_POINT();
00440                 if (fd != -1) {
00441                         int ret = syscalls::close(fd);
00442                         fd = -1;
00443                         if (ret == -1) {
00444                                 int e = errno;
00445                                 if (errno == EIO) {
00446                                         throw SystemException(
00447                                                 "A write operation on the session stream failed",
00448                                                 e);
00449                                 } else {
00450                                         throw SystemException(
00451                                                 "Cannot close the session stream",
00452                                                 e);
00453                                 }
00454                         }
00455                 }
00456         }
00457         
00458         virtual void discardStream() {
00459                 fd = -1;
00460         }
00461         
00462         virtual pid_t getPid() const {
00463                 return pid;
00464         }
00465 };
